Glaucia da Conceição Pereira

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/9805674960191506
  • Última atualização do currículo em 15/05/2015

Ms. Glaucia Pereira is a Ph.D. Researcher in Biomechanics at Imperial College, London. Prior to joining Imperial College she held a MCINN Research Fellowship in Modelling and Numerical Simulations in the Centre for Environmental Technological and High Energy Research (Ciemat-Madrid), Spain and a HELEN-CERN Research Fellowship in Medical Physics in the same Centre. She received her M.Sc. in Computational Systems Engineering (Artificial Intelligence) from the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro (COPPE), Brazil and her B.Sc. in Theoretical Mathematics from the State University of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil in 2005. Her current research is focussed on non-Newtonian blood flow and arterial wall mechanisms underlying biomechanical stimuli under disease conditions. To that end she is developing a multiphase and fluid-structure interaction (FSI) model of blood-arterial wall dynamics combined with experimental data from flow measurements (Magneto Resonance Imaging) and structural images (Magneto Resonance Imaging and Optical Coherence Tomography) to study shear stress and wall stress modulated by flow characteristics. It is translated into the development of a new non-Newtonian FSI-OCT model, which is supported by microfluidics experiments. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Projetos de pesquisa
2005 - 2008
HELEN UFRJ-Ciemat-CERN
Descrição: El Proyecto HELEN (High Energy Physics Latinamerican European Network ? Red Latinoamericana-Europea para la Física de Altas Energías) es una iniciativa europea creada para integrar a la comunidad científica latinoamericana (pertinente al desarrollo de la Física de Altas Energías y Partículas Elementales) dentro de los grupos europeos correspondientes que realizan investigaciones de muy alto nivel en estas áreas. El proyecto (creado el 29 April 2004) tiene una duración de 3 años, empezando desde el agosto-2005 hasta julio-2008..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Glaucia da Conceição Pereira - Integrante / Miguel Embid - Coordenador.
